description: OpenRCT2 is an open-source re-implementation of RollerCoaster Tycoon 2 (RCT2), expanding the game with new features, fixing bugs and raising game limits.
startup: ./OpenRCT2/openrct2-cli --version && ./OpenRCT2/openrct2-cli host $(if {{LOAD_AUTOSAVE}} && [ -d ServerData/save/autosave/ ]; then find ServerData/save/autosave/ | sort -r | head -1; else echo "{{SAVE_URI}}"; fi) --port {{SERVER_PORT}} --user-data-path /home/container/ServerData/

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash

## File: Pterodactyl OpenRCT2 Egg - egg-openrct2.json
## Authors: David Wolfe (Red-Thirten), parkervcp
## Date: 2022/01/12
## License: MIT License

GITHUB_PACKAGE="OpenRCT2/OpenRCT2"
MATCH="linux-bullseye-x86_64.tar.gz"
DEFAULT_SAVE="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/parkervcp/eggs/master/game_eggs/tycoon_games/openrct2/save.park"

## OpenRCT2 Install
apt -y update
[ ! -d /mnt/server ] && mkdir /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server
# Remove existing installation if present
[ -d OpenRCT2 ] && rm -rf OpenRCT2

# Determine if installing from source or from release
if [ "${VERSION}" == "develop" ]; then
    # Get required packages
    apt -y install curl git make cmake gcc build-essential libicu-dev pkg-config libcurl4-openssl-dev libcrypto++-dev libpng-dev libssl-dev libzip-dev duktape-dev nlohmann-json3-dev
    echo -e "\nInstalling/Updating OpenRCT2 from source...\n"
    # Setup temp directory for building and move to it
    [ -d temp ] && rm -rf temp
    mkdir temp && cd temp
    # Clone the branch and check if successful
    git clone --branch "${VERSION}" https://github.com/${GITHUB_PACKAGE}
    if [ ! -d OpenRCT2 ]; then
        echo -e "\nFailed to clone \"${VERSION}\" branch from https://github.com/${GITHUB_PACKAGE}\n"
        exit 1
    fi
    cd OpenRCT2
    mkdir build && cd build
    # Prepare CMake files for a lightweight and CLI-only build of OpenRCT2, using the appropriate flags
    cmake .. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON -DPORTABLE=ON -DCMAKE_POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE=ON -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-g -gz" -DDISABLE_TTF=ON -DDISABLE_GOOGLE_BENCHMARK=ON -DDISABLE_DISCORD_RPC=ON -DDISABLE_GUI=ON
    echo -e "\nBuilding OpenRCT2 package from source...\n\tThis process can take quite some time. Grab a coffee :)\n"
    # Build OpenRCT2
    DESTDIR=. make install
    # Check if build was successful and move to it
    if [ ! -d usr/local ]; then
        echo -e "\nFailed to successfully build OpenRCT2!\n"
        exit 1
    fi
    cd usr/local
    # Make executable-ready package by moving compiled files to the correct locations
    mkdir -p /mnt/server/OpenRCT2/data
    mv bin/* /mnt/server/OpenRCT2/
    mv share/openrct2/* share/openrct2-cli/* /mnt/server/OpenRCT2/data/
    mv share/doc /mnt/server/OpenRCT2/
    cd /mnt/server
    rm -rf temp # Clean up temp building directory
    echo -e "\nBuild of OpenRCT2 package complete!"
else
    # Get required packages
    apt install -y curl jq
    echo -e "\nInstalling/Updating OpenRCT2 from release tag \"${VERSION}\"...\n"
    # This is a simple script to use the GitHub API for release versions.
    # This requires the egg has a variable for GITHUB_PACKAGE, VERSION and MATCH (MATCH is to match the filename in some way).
    # Get release info and download links
    LATEST_JSON=$(curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_PACKAGE}/releases/latest")
    RELEASES=$(curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/${GITHUB_PACKAGE}/releases")

    if [ -z "${VERSION}" ] || [ "${VERSION}" == "latest" ]; then
        DOWNLOAD_URL=$(echo ${LATEST_JSON} | jq .assets | jq -r .[].browser_download_url | grep -i ${MATCH})
    else
        VERSION_CHECK=$(echo ${RELEASES} | jq -r --arg VERSION "${VERSION}" '.[] | select(.tag_name==$VERSION) | .tag_name')
        if [ "${VERSION}" == "${VERSION_CHECK}" ]; then
            DOWNLOAD_URL=$(echo ${RELEASES} | jq -r --arg VERSION "${VERSION}" '.[] | select(.tag_name==$VERSION) | .assets[].browser_download_url' | grep -i ${MATCH})
        else
            DOWNLOAD_URL=$(echo ${LATEST_JSON} | jq .assets | jq -r .[].browser_download_url)
        fi
    fi
    # Download and unpackage the release
    curl -L ${DOWNLOAD_URL} | tar -xzv
    # Check if it was successful
    if [ -d OpenRCT2 ]; then
        echo -e "\nDownload of OpenRCT2 release successful!"
    else
        echo -e "\nFailed to download/unpack file: ${DOWNLOAD_URL}\n"
        exit 1
    fi
fi

## OpenRCT2 Setup
# Setup ServerData/save directory
[ ! -d ServerData/save ] && mkdir -p ServerData/save
cd ServerData/save
# Download default save.park if missing
if [ ! -f save.park ]; then
    echo -e "Downloading default save.park file from ${DEFAULT_SAVE}"
    curl -sSLO ${DEFAULT_SAVE}
fi

echo -e "\nOpenRCT2 Successfully Installed!"

variables.name: Save File
variables.description: Save file (.sv4 / .sv6 / .park) to load. Can be a file path or can be a webhosted file URL. An existing save file must be specified; the server cannot generate a new scenario/save from scratch.

variables.name: Load Latest Autosave
variables.description: Will load the latest autosave (assuming one is present) *instead* of the Save File when the server is started. Useful for loading the latest progress of a park after a reboot. Set to "false" to "lock" progress of the park, and always load the original Save File on start up.

variables.name: Autosave Interval
variables.description: 0 = Every 1 min, 1 = Every 5 min, 2 = Every 15 min, 3 = Every 30 min, 4 = Every hour, 5 = Never

variables.name: Autosaves To Keep
variables.description: Number of autosaves to keep before rolling over and deleting the oldest one. Set to 0 to disable autosaving.

variables.name: Max Players
variables.description: Maximum players allowed to connect to the server.

variables.name: Server Password
variables.description: Password requested by the server for clients to connect. Admins do not have to enter password to join. Leave empty for no password.

variables.name: Advertise Server
variables.description: If set to "false", the server will not be advertised in the master server list, and clients must manually connect.

variables.name: Pause Server If No Clients
variables.description: Set to "true" to have the server pause simulation if no clients are on the server.

variables.name: Server Name
variables.description: Name of the server that appears in the server list.

variables.name: Server Description
variables.description: Description of the server that appears when hovering over the server in the server list.

variables.name: Server Player Name
variables.description: The server appears as a player in the player list. This is the name it will have.

variables.name: Server Greeting
variables.description: The "Message of the Day" that gets sent to all clients who join.

variables.name: Provider Name
variables.description: Server provider name that appears in server information window.

variables.name: Server Provider E-Mail
variables.description: Server provider e-mail that appears in server information window.

variables.name: Server Provider Website
variables.description: Server provider website that appears in server information window.

variables.name: Log Chat
variables.description: Set to "true" if you would like in-game chat logged to file in Data/chatlogs.

variables.name: Log Server Actions
variables.description: Set to "true" if you would like in-game actions logged to file in Data/serverlogs.

variables.name: OpenRCT2 Version
variables.description: The release tag (version) of OpenRCT2 to download and install from their official Github (ie. "v0.3.5.1"). Use "latest" to download the latest release, or "develop" to build from the latest source (takes longer to install but is the most up to date).
